title: Calories in a Fried Plantain
meta_description: Learn calories in a plantain fried, with full nutrition facts per serving, macros, and easy tweaks for healthier options.
assumptions: Medium ripe plantain (approx. 150 g), sliced and deep-fried in vegetable oil until golden; no added salt or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by plantain ripeness, size, oil type/absorption, and frying method. Check labels or recipes when available.

quick_answer.text: One medium fried plantain provides ~365 kcal, mostly from carbs and added oil.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Bake instead of fry (no added oil)

faqs.q: How many calories in a fried plantain?
faqs.a: About 365 kcal for one medium fried plantain.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a plantain fried?
faqs.a: Roughly 59 g carbs, including 25 g sugars and 4 g fiber.

faqs.q: Is a fried plantain high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, ~16 g total fat due to oil absorption during frying.

faqs.q: How does baking change calories in a plantain fried?
faqs.a: Baking reduces calories to ~165 kcal by eliminating added oil.
Riper plantains are sweeter with more sugars; green ones have more resistant starch and fewer calories.
